body.p: To the excelence of the govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioner Hiram Faulkner wold Respectively represent to your excelency that at the August terme of the Whitley Circuit court that the Grandjury found an enditement against him for gaiming and at the last march tirm the court Rendered judgement against him for twenty dollars and that he Repaid the same with as his suritey he states that he is a pore man and not able to pay the fine and do justice to the ballance of his familey he say that he have ever been a union man and submiss to the laws and that he is not a gambler only axidentley got in ths scrape Wheare fore he pray that your excelence may interfere withe his ^your^ pardning Power and to Remit the fine and set a side the forfeitu Replevin bond and judgement and for all Proper Releaf
sworn to by Hiram Faulkner this 28th day of 1864
The under Signed say thay beleave the statements in the foregoing petition and thinkes it wold be an acts of charity to Remite the fine

John Smith
Michael Richardson
A J Hurd
P Mendon
Joel Baker
Joel Wilder
Charles P Davis
J H Scott
Thomas Adkins
Thomas Taylor

Whitley Cir Ct
H Faulkner
To Petition
Whitley Co.
Refused
July 14th 1864

Address P. O.
Whitley C. H.
